I just installed the pack and tried some warping, after warping for about 1 minute there was an explosion and everything except my capsule was gone. The game log showed that the RTG's I'd included had collided with the fuel tank they were attached to.

I love the method of generating exotic matter, I have a plethora of solar panels on my test ship (which is basically a cupola with the alc drive underneath, then an orange tank attached to a mainsail) and on 4 x time warp I can make a full tank of exotic matter in about 4-5 minutes. The need for xenon gas as well will keep it realistic!

My 8 month old son loves the warp bubble effect, he was sitting in my lap kicking and waving his arms with excitement every time I fired up the warp drive

First of all, I would like to point out your extreme awesomeness. Seriously! A few weeks ago I made a general request for a warp drive. He replied with 15 minutes O_O.

That aside, I would like to make some suggestions. I think that there should be more than one drive, such as a 1c limited basic drive, a tiny subluminal drive for probes, or a giant hyperluminal drive that combines the technologies of the Alcubierre drive with the bone-crushing Power of the karborundum torch drive.

I really like the idea of your mod.

Would it be possible to get a few alternate models for it though? I was thinking of a small stack mounted version about half the thickness of a battery. It would be fairly unnoticable and allow you to use it in any design like the IXS warpship or any of the Star Trek ships available. If there were 1.25, 2.5 and 3.75 meter versions it would cover being able to integrate it into pretty much any design.

Any chance of this?

Some other points I noticed:

1) Anything attached to the front of the ship seems to be fair game for the space kraken, even though it is well within the bubble. I had solar panels and amechjeb AR202 case attached to the cupola that was on the front of the drive section and all were destroyed after only 1 or 2 warp jumps.

2) When dropping out of warp the ship always seems to start spinning.

Other than these small points it's great! I'm currently orbiting Eeloo after a longish warp trip!

There are no immediate plans for alternate models. And no plans for multi-drive support.

Any additional models would likely be a 1.25 and a 3.75 but not any time soon.

Warp instabilities, explosions if things get stretched out of the bubble, and disorientation post warp are unity oddities I will leave in as balance factors. Try a more gentle throttle foot

is it possible just to warp in a straight line to somewhere? And yes, I've had great success using thrust limiter to 94 percent with no horrific bad things happening..

is it possible just to warp in a straight line to somewhere? And yes, I've had great success using thrust limiter to 94 percent with no horrific bad things happening..

The best way to warp IS in a straight line - no need for maneuver nodes - simply select your target body, line up with the pink circle target icon in your nav ball and warp (this will require several warps for distant targets due to loss of exotic matter and recharge times - point your craft to the target again and repeat) - the blue trajectory line in your map view will show you your orbit/trajectory if you were to drop out of warp at a particular time (the resulting relative velocity of when you are moving through space and not you moving space around you).

Also, I hadn't thought about reducing the thrust limiter - but it does appear to help reduce damage due to heavy handed throttle (warp engage) control.

@RoverDude RE: Exotic Matter depletion damage...

It does seem that a lot of people playing will end up exploding parts on their craft more frequently than not, rendering their build useless and possibly too far away from home to rescue (in career mode I assume it will cost a fortune to build a second one).

I tend to try and catch the Exotic Matter 'flameout' at the last split second - most of the time I am pretty good at coming to a complete warp stop - but occasionally do not stop in time.

Just an idea and wondering if it would be possible to implement about a second or two delay between Exotic Matter depletion and exploding parts?

The AGFX Flameout detector from Smart Parts works with the warp drive when placed directly above it (scaled to 200%, it actually fits quite nicely) and will deactivate the drive when a flameout is detected which seems to reduce further damage - but does not happen quite fast enough as damage seems instant.

Using this mod (or perhaps others that do the same) could help the heavy handed of us make better use and re-usability of our beloved warp drives.

RoverDude, what is required if we wanted to make our own drives using your plugin? I'm planning to make a small short hop radial mount drive for small space planes.

RoverDude, what is required if we wanted to make our own drives using your plugin? I'm planning to make a small short hop radial mount drive for small space planes.

You need two animations.

One that plays when the drive is engaged/disengaged

One that plays in a loop while the drive is active (and the animation speed is based on the throttle)
